headline: CARFAX: Odometer Rollbacks See Dramatic Jump of 14% to 2.45 Million Vehicles
summary: Odometer fraud is a serious and growing concern for used car buyers across the country. New CARFAX data shows roughly 2.45 million cars on the road are suspected to have had their odometers rolled back, a sharp 14% increase from just last year. To put that into perspective, 2023 to 2024 saw a 4% increase year-over-year.

headline: Asia-Pacific markets trade mixed as investors parse Japan trade data
summary: Asia-Pacific markets traded mixed after Wall Street declined as investors assessed the delayed U.S. jobs data for November.

headline: Is S&P Global Still Attractive After Recent Data Push and Slower Share Price Gains?
summary: If you are wondering whether S&P Global at around $499 a share is still a smart buy, or if most of the upside has already been priced in, this breakdown will help you see what the market might be missing. The stock has inched up 1.8% over the last week and 1.2% over the past month, but zooming out shows a modest 0.8% gain year to date and just 0.6% over the last year, versus a much stronger 54.2% return over three years and 63.3% over five. Recent headlines have centered on S&P Global's push...

headline: S&P Global Adds Hubert Joly to its Board of Directors
summary: S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI) announced today that its Board of Directors has approved the addition of Mr. Hubert Joly to the Board, effective January 2, 2026.

headline: S&P Global Announces Mobility Business Chief Financial Officer
summary: S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI) today announced the appointment of Matt Calderone as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of the Mobility business, joining the company by March 1, 2026. Mr. Calderone will serve as the CFO of the standalone public company through its planned separation from S&P Global and will oversee all aspects of the company's Finance function. He will report to Mr. Bill Eager, President of S&P Global Mobility, and CEO-designate of the future standalone company.
